paper_abstract: It is estimated that between 80% and 90% of governmental data collections contain address information. Geocoding - the process of assigning geographic coordinates to addresses - is becoming increasingly important in application areas that involve the analysis and mining of such data. In many cases, address records are captured and/or stored in a free-form or inconsistent manner. This fact complicates the task of accurately matching such addresses to spatially-an notated reference data. In this paper we describe a geocoding system that is based on a comprehensive high-quality geocoded national address database. It uses a learning address parser based on hidden Markov models to segment free-form addresses into components, and a rule-based matching engine to determine the best matches to the reference database.
paper_title: A Probabilistic geocoding system utilising a parcel based address file
